sec.title: CityGML Data Dictionary
sec.p: The CityGML UML model is the normative definition of the CityGML Conceptual Model. The Data Dictionary tables in this section were software generated from the UML model. As such, this section provides a normative representation of the CityGML Conceptual Model.
An alternate representation can be found in the Conceptual Model in .

sec.title: ISO Classes
sec.p: The following classes are defined in ISO standards and used by the CityGML Conceptual Model.

tr.td: AnyFeature is an abstract class that is the generalization of all feature types. AnyFeature is an instance of the «metaclass» FeatureType [cf. ISO 19109].

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: A coverage that returns the same feature attribute values for every direct position within any single spatial object, temporal object or spatiotemporal object in its domain.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: DirectPosition object data types (Figure 14) hold the coordinates for a position within some coordinate reference system. The coordinate reference system is described in ISO 19111. Since DirectPositions, as data types, will often be included in larger objects (such as GM_Objects) that have references to ISO19111::SC_CRS, the DirectPosition::cordinateReferenceSystem may be left NULL if this particular DirectPosition is included in a larger object with such a reference to a SC_CRS. In this case, the DirectPosition::cordinateReferenceSystem is implicitly assumed to take on the value of the containing object’s SC_CRS.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: GM_Object is the root class of the geometric object taxonomy and supports interfaces common to all geographically referenced geometric objects. GM_Object instances are sets of direct positions in a particular coordinate reference system. A GM_Object can be regarded as an infinite set of points that satisfies the set operation interfaces for a set of direct positions, TransfiniteSet<DirectPosition>. Since an infinite collection class cannot be implemented directly, a Boolean test for inclusion shall be provided by the GM_Object interface. This international standard concentrates on vector geometry classes, but future work may use GM_Object as a root class without modification. NOTE As a type, GM_Object does not have a well-defined default state or value representation as a data type. Instantiated subclasses of GM_Object will.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: An aggregate class containing only instances of GM_OrientableCurve. The association role “element” shall be the set of GM_OrientableCurves contained in this GM_MultiCurve.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: GM_MultiPoint is an aggregate class containing only points. The association role “element” shall be the set of GM_Points contained in this GM_MultiPoint.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: An aggregate class containing only instances of GM_OrientableSurface. The association role “element” shall be the set of GM_OrientableSurfaces contained in this GM_MultiSurface.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: GM_Point is the basic data type for a geometric object consisting of one and only one point.

The attribute “position” shall be the DirectPosition of this GM_Point. GM_Point::position [1] : DirectPosition NOTE In most cases, the state of a GM_Point is fully determined by its position attribute. The only exception to this is if the GM_Point has been subclassed to provide additional non-geometric information such as symbology.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: GM_Solid, a subclass of GM_Primitive, is the basis for 3-dimensional geometry. The extent of a solid is defined by the boundary surfaces.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: GM_Surface is a subclass of GM_Primitive and is the basis for 2-dimensional geometry. Unorientable surfaces such as the Möbius band are not allowed. The orientation of a surface chooses an “up” direction through the choice of the upward normal, which, if the surface is not a cycle, is the side of the surface from which the exterior boundary appears counterclockwise. Reversal of the surface orientation reverses the curve orientation of each boundary component, and interchanges the conceptual “up” and “down” direction of the surface. If the surface is the boundary of a solid, the “up” direction is usually outward. For closed surfaces, which have no boundary, the up direction is that of the surface patches, which must be consistent with one another. Its included GM_SurfacePatches describe the interior structure of a GM_Surface. NOTE Other than the restriction on orientability, no other “validity” condition is required for GM_Surface.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: A GM_Tin is a GM_TriangulatedSurface that uses the Delaunay algorithm or a similar algorithm complemented with consideration for breaklines, stoplines and maximum length of triangle sides (Figure 22). These networks satisfy the Delaunay criterion away from the modifications: For each triangle in the network, the circle passing through its vertexes does not contain, in its interior, the vertex of any other triangle.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: A GM_TriangulatedSurface is a GM_PolyhedralSurface that is composed only of triangles (GM_Triangle). There is no restriction on how the triangulation is derived.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: Coordinate reference system which is usually single but may be compound.
Not-navigable association from a Coordinate Operation that uses ths CRS as its targetCRS.
Description of usage, or limitations of usage, for which this CRS is valid. If unknown, enter “not known”.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: TM_Position is a union class that consists of one of the data types listed as its attributes. Date, Time, and DateTime are basic data types defined in ISO/TS 19103.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attribute and role names have the stereotype «Property»

tr.td: The Core module defines the basic components of the CityGML data model. The Core module defines abstract base classes that define the core properties of more specialized thematic classes defined in other modules. The Core module also defines concrete classes that are common to other modules, for example basic data types.
AbstractAppearance is the abstract superclass to represent any kind of appearance objects.
Augments AbstractAppearance with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractCityObject is the abstract superclass of all thematic classes within the CityGML Conceptual Model.

Relates generalized representations of the same real-world object in different Levels of Detail to the city object. The direction of this relation is from the city object to the corresponding generalized city objects.
Relates generic attributes to the city object.
Relates Dynamizer objects to the city object. These allow timeseries data to override static attribute values of the city object.
Relates appearances to the city object.
References external objects in other information systems that have a relation to the city object.
Relates other city objects to the city object. It also describes how the city objects are related to each other.
Describes the vertical position of the city object relative to the surrounding terrain.
Describes the vertical position of the city object relative to the surrounding water surface.
Augments AbstractCityObject with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractDynamizer is the abstract superclass to represent Dynamizer objects.
Augments AbstractDynamizer with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractFeature is the abstract superclass of all feature types within the CityGML Conceptual Model.
Specifies the unique identifier of the feature that is valid in the instance document within which it occurs.
Specifies the unique identifier of the feature that is valid globally.
Specifies the name of the feature.
Provides further information on the feature.
Augments AbstractFeature with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractFeatureWithLifespan is the base class for all CityGML features. This class allows the optional specification of the real-world and database times for the existence of each feature.
Indicates the date at which a CityGML feature was added to the CityModel.
Indicates the date at which a CityGML feature was removed from the CityModel.
Indicates the date at which a CityGML feature started to exist in the real world.
Indicates the date at which a CityGML feature ended to exist in the real world.
Augments AbstractFeatureWithLifespan with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractLogicalSpace is the abstract superclass for all types of logical spaces. Logical space refers to spaces that are not bounded by physical surfaces but are defined according to thematic considerations.
Augments AbstractLogicalSpace with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractOccupiedSpace is the abstract superclass for all types of physically occupied spaces. Occupied space refers to spaces that are partially or entirely filled with matter.
Relates to an implicit geometry that represents the occupied space in Level of Detail 3.
Relates to an implicit geometry that represents the occupied space in Level of Detail 1.
Relates to an implicit geometry that represents the occupied space in Level of Detail 2.
Augments AbstractOccupiedSpace with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractPhysicalSpace is the abstract superclass for all types of physical spaces. Physical space refers to spaces that are fully or partially bounded by physical objects.
Relates to a 3D MultiCurve geometry that represents the terrain intersection curve of the physical space in Level of Detail 3.
Relates to a 3D MultiCurve geometry that represents the terrain intersection curve of the physical space in Level of Detail 2.
Relates to a 3D PointCloud that represents the physical space.
Relates to a 3D MultiCurve geometry that represents the terrain intersection curve of the physical space in Level of Detail 1.
Augments AbstractPhysicalSpace with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractPointCloud is the abstract superclass to represent PointCloud objects.
Augments AbstractPointCloud with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractSpace is the abstract superclass for all types of spaces. A space is an entity of volumetric extent in the real world.
Relates to a 3D MultiCurve geometry that represents the space in Level of Detail 2.
Relates to a 3D MultiCurve geometry that represents the space in Level of Detail 0.
Relates to a 3D MultiSurface geometry that represents the space in Level of Detail 0.
Relates to a 3D MultiSurface geometry that represents the space in Level of Detail 2.
Relates to a 3D MultiSurface geometry that represents the space in Level of Detail 3.
Relates to a 3D Point geometry that represents the space in Level of Detail 0.
Relates to a 3D Solid geometry that represents the space in Level of Detail 3.
Relates to a 3D MultiCurve geometry that represents the space in Level of Detail 3.
Relates to a 3D Solid geometry that represents the space in Level of Detail 2.
Relates to surfaces that bound the space.
Relates to a 3D Solid geometry that represents the space in Level of Detail 1.
Specifies the degree of openness of a space.
Specifies qualified volumes related to the space.
Specifies qualified areas related to the space.
Augments AbstractSpace with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractSpaceBoundary is the abstract superclass for all types of space boundaries. A space boundary is an entity with areal extent in the real world. Space boundaries are objects that bound a Space. They also realize the contact between adjacent spaces.
Augments AbstractSpaceBoundary with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractThematicSurface is the abstract superclass for all types of thematic surfaces.
Relates to a 3D MultiSurface geometry that represents the thematic surface in Level of Detail 1.
Relates to a 3D PointCloud that represents the thematic surface.
Relates to a 3D MultiCurve geometry that represents the thematic surface in Level of Detail 0.
Relates to a 3D MultiSurface geometry that represents the thematic surface in Level of Detail 3.
Relates to a 3D MultiSurface geometry that represents the thematic surface in Level of Detail 0.
Relates to a 3D MultiSurface geometry that represents the thematic surface in Level of Detail 2.
Specifies qualified areas related to the thematic surface.
Augments AbstractThematicSurface with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractUnoccupiedSpace is the abstract superclass for all types of physically unoccupied spaces. Unoccupied space refers to spaces that are entirely or mostly free of matter.
Augments AbstractUnoccupiedSpace with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractVersion is the abstract superclass to represent Version objects.
Augments AbstractVersion with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractVersionTransition is the abstract superclass to represent VersionTransition objects.
Augments AbstractVersionTransition with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: Address represents an address of a city object.
Relates to the MultiPoint geometry of the Address. The geometry relates the address spatially to a city object.
Relates an OASIS address object to the Address.
Augments the Address with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: CityModel is the container for all objects belonging to a city model.
Relates to all objects that are part of the CityModel.

Specifies the local engineering coordinate reference system of the CityModel that can be provided inline the CityModel instead of referencing a well-known CRS definition. The definition of an engineering CRS requires an anchor point which relates the origin of the local coordinate system to a point on the earth’s surface in order to facilitate the transformation of coordinates from the local engineering CRS.
Augments the CityModel with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: CityObjectRelation represents a specific relation from the city object in which the relation is included to another city object.
Relates generic attributes to the CityObjectRelation.
Indicates the specific type of the CityObjectRelation.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: ClosureSurface is a special type of thematic surface used to close holes in volumetric objects. Closure surfaces are virtual (non-physical) surfaces.
Augments the ClosureSurface with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: ImplicitGeometry is a geometry representation where the shape is stored only once as a prototypical geometry. Examples are a tree or other vegetation object, a traffic light or a traffic sign. This prototypic geometry object can be re-used or referenced many times, wherever the corresponding feature occurs in the 3D city model.
Relates to a prototypical geometry in a local coordinate system stored inline with the city model.
Relates to a 3D Point geometry that represents the base point of the object in the world coordinate system.
Specifies the unique identifier of the ImplicitGeometry.
Specifies the mathematical transformation (translation, rotation, and scaling) between the prototypical geometry and the actual spatial position of the object.
Specifies the MIME type of the external file that stores the prototypical geometry.
Specifies the URI that points to the prototypical geometry stored in an external file.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractGenericAttribute is the abstract superclass for all types of generic attributes.
ADEOfAbstractAppearance acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractAppearance.
ADEOfAbstractCityObject acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractCityObject.
ADEOfAbstractDynamizer acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractDynamizer.
ADEOfAbstractFeature acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractFeature.
ADEOfAbstractFeatureWithLifespan acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractFeatureWithLifespan.
ADEOfAbstractLogicalSpace acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractLogicalSpace.
ADEOfAbstractOccupiedSpace acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractOccupiedSpace.
ADEOfAbstractPhysicalSpace acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractPhysicalSpace.
ADEOfAbstractPointCloud acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractPointCloud.
ADEOfAbstractSpace acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractSpace.
ADEOfAbstractSpaceBoundary acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractSpaceBoundary.
ADEOfAbstractThematicSurface acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractThematicSurface.
ADEOfAbstractUnoccupiedSpace acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractUnoccupiedSpace.
ADEOfAbstractVersion acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractVersion.
ADEOfAbstractVersionTransition acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractVersionTransition.
ADEOfAddress acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to an Address.
ADEOfCityModel acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a CityModel.
ADEOfClosureSurface acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a ClosureSurface.

ExternalReference is a reference to a corresponding object in another information system, for example in the German cadastre (ALKIS), the German topographic information system (ATKIS), or the OS UK MasterMap®.
Specifies the URI that points to the object in the external information system.
Specifies the URI that points to the external information system.

Specifies a URI that additionally qualifies the ExternalReference. The URI can point to a definition from an external ontology (e.g. the sameAs relation from OWL) and allows for mapping the ExternalReference to RDF triples.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: Occupancy is an application-dependent indication of what is contained by a feature.
Indicates the number of occupants contained by a feature.
Indicates the time period the occupants are contained by a feature.
Indicates the specific type of the occupants that are contained by a feature.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: QualifiedArea is an application-dependent measure of the area of a space or of a thematic surface.
Specifies the value of the QualifiedArea.
Indicates the specific type of the QualifiedArea.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: QualifiedVolume is an application-dependent measure of the volume of a space.
Specifies the value of the QualifiedVolume.
Indicates the specific type of the QualifiedVolume.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: XALAddress represents address details according to the OASIS xAL standard.
Code is a basic type for a String-based term, keyword, or name that can additionally have a code space.
Associates the Code with an authority that controls the term, keyword, or name.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: DoubleBetween0and1 is a basic type for values, which are greater or equal than 0 and less or equal than 1. The type is used for color encoding, for example.
valueBetween0and1 (OCL): inv: DoubleBetween0and1.allInstances() → forAll(p | p > = 0 and p < = 1)
DoubleBetween0and1List is a basic type that represents a list of double values greater or equal than 0 and less or equal than 1. The type is used for color encoding, for example.
Specifies the list of double values.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: DoubleList is an ordered sequence of double values.
Specifies the list of double values.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: DoubleOrNilReasonList is a basic type that represents a list of double values and/or nil reasons.
Specifies the list of double values and/or nil reasons.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: ID is a basic type that represents a unique identifier.
IntegerBetween0and3 is a basic type for integer values, which are greater or equal than 0 and less or equal than 3. The type is used for encoding the LOD number.
valueBetween0and3 (OCL): inv: IntegerBetween0and3.allInstances() → forAll(p | p > = 0 and p < = 3)
MeasureOrNilReasonList is a basic type that represents a list of double values and/or nil reasons together with a unit of measurement.
Specifies the unit of measurement of the double values.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: TransformationMatrix2×2 is a 2 by 2 matrix represented as a list of four double values in row major order.
TransformationMatrix3×4 is a 3 by 4 matrix represented as a list of twelve double values in row major order.
TransformationMatrix4×4 is a 4 by 4 matrix represented as a list of sixteen double values in row major order.
CityModelMember is a union type that enumerates the different types of objects that can occur as members of a city model.
Specifies the city objects that are part of the CityModel.
Specifies the appearances of the CityModel.
Specifies the different versions of the CityModel.
Specifies the transitions between the different versions of the CityModel.

Specifies the feature objects that are part of the CityModel. It allows to include objects that are not derived from a class defined in the CityGML conceptual model, but from the ISO 19109 class AnyFeature.
DoubleOrNilReason is a union type that allows for choosing between a double value and a nil reason.
NilReason is a union type that allows for choosing between two different types of nil reason.
Indicates a nil reason that is provided in a code list.
Specifies a URI that points to a resource that describes the nil reason.
IntervalValue is a code list used to specify a time period.
MimeTypeValue is a code list used to specify the MIME type of a referenced resource.
NilReasonEnumeration is a code list that enumerates the different nil reasons.
OccupantTypeValue is a code list used to classify occupants.
OtherRelationTypeValue is a code list used to classify other types of city object relations.
QualifiedAreaTypeValue is a code list used to specify area types.
QualifiedVolumeTypeValue is a code list used to specify volume types.
RelationTypeValue is a code list used to classify city object relations.
TemporalRelationTypeValue is a code list used to classify temporal city object relations.
TopologicalRelationTypeValue is a code list used to classify topological city object relations.
RelativeToTerrain enumerates the spatial relations of a city object relative to terrain in a qualitative way.
Indicates that the city object is located entirely above the terrain.
Indicates that the city object is for the most part located above the terrain.
Indicates that the city object is located half above the terrain and half below the terrain.
Indicates that the city object is for the most part located below the terrain.
Indicates that the city object is located entirely below the terrain.
RelativeToWater enumerates the spatial relations of a city object relative to the water surface in a qualitative way.
Indicates that the city object is located entirely above the water surface.
Indicates that the city object is for the most part located above the water surface.
Indicates that the city object is located half above the water surface and half below the water surface.
Indicates that the city object is for the most part located below the water surface.
Indicates that the city object is located entirely below the water surface.
Indicates that the city object is temporarily located above or below the water level, because the height of the water surface is varying.
SpaceType is an enumeration that characterises a space according to its closure properties.
Indicates that the space has boundaries at the bottom, at the top, and on all sides.
Indicates that the space has at maximum a boundary at the bottom.
Indicates that the space has a boundary at the bottom and on at least one side.
The Appearance module supports the modelling of the observable surface properties of CityGML features in the form of textures and material.
AbstractSurfaceData is the abstract superclass for different kinds of textures and material.
Indicates whether the texture or material is assigned to the front side or the back side of the surface geometry object.
Augments AbstractSurfaceData with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractTexture is the abstract superclass to represent the common attributes of the classes ParameterizedTexture and GeoreferencedTexture.
Specifies the URI that points to the external image data file.
Specifies the MIME type of the external point cloud file.
Indicates the specific type of the texture.
Specifies the behaviour of the texture when the texture is smaller than the surface to which it is applied.
Specifies the color of that part of the surface that is not covered by the texture.
Augments AbstractTexture with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: An Appearance is a collection of surface data, i.e. observable properties for surface geometry objects in the form of textures and material.
Relates to the surface data that are part of the Appearance.
Specifies the topic of the Appearance. Each Appearance contains surface data for one theme only. Examples of themes are infrared radiation, noise pollution, or earthquake-induced structural stress.
Augments the Appearance with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: A GeoreferencedTexture is a texture that uses a planimetric projection. It contains an implicit parameterization that is either stored within the image file, an accompanying world file or specified using the orientation and referencePoint elements.
Relates to the 2D Point geometry that represents the center of the upper left image pixel in world space.
Indicates whether the georeference from the image file or the accompanying world file should be preferred.
Specifies the rotation and scaling of the image in form of a 2×2 matrix.
Specifies the URI that points to the surface geometry objects to which the texture is applied.
Augments the GeoreferencedTexture with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: A ParameterizedTexture is a texture that uses texture coordinates or a transformation matrix for parameterization.
Relates to the texture coordinates or transformation matrices used for parameterization.
Augments the ParameterizedTexture with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: TextureAssociation denotes the relation of a texture to a surface geometry object.
Specifies the URI that points to the surface geometry object to which the texture is applied.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: X3DMaterial defines properties for surface geometry objects based on the material definitions from the X3D and COLLADA standards.
Specifies the minimum percentage of diffuseColor that is visible regardless of light sources.
Specifies the color of the light diffusely reflected by the surface geometry object.
Specifies the color of the light emitted by the surface geometry object.
Specifies the color of the light directly reflected by the surface geometry object.
Specifies the sharpness of the specular highlight.
Specifies the degree of transparency of the surface geometry object.

Specifies which interpolation method is used for the shading of the surface geometry object. If the attribute is set to true, vertex normals should be used for shading (Gouraud shading). Otherwise, normals should be constant for a surface patch (flat shading).
Specifies the URI that points to the surface geometry objects to which the material is applied.
Augments the X3DMaterial with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractTextureParameterization is the abstract superclass for different kinds of texture parameterizations.
ADEOfAbstractSurfaceData acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractSurfaceData.
ADEOfAbstractTexture acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractTexture.
ADEOfAppearance acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to an Appearance.
ADEOfGeoreferencedTexture acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a GeoreferencedTexture.
ADEOfParameterizedTexture acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a ParameterizedTexture.
ADEOfX3DMaterial acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to an X3DMaterial.
TexCoordGen defines texture parameterization using a transformation matrix.
Relates to the coordinate reference system of the transformation matrix.
Specifies the 3×4 transformation matrix that defines the transformation between world coordinates and texture coordinates.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: TexCoordList defines texture parameterization using texture coordinates.
Specifies the coordinates of texture used for parameterization. The texture coordinates are provided separately for each LinearRing of the surface geometry object.
Specifies the URIs that point to the LinearRings that are parameterized using the given texture coordinates.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: Color is a list of three double values between 0 and 1 defining an RGB color value.
Color is a list of four double values between 0 and 1 defining an RGBA color value. Opacity value of 0 means transparent.

sec.title: Unions
sec.p: none

sec.title: Code Lists
sec.p: none

tr.td: TextureType enumerates the different texture types.
Indicates that the texture is specific to a single surface.
Indicates that the texture is characteristic of a surface and can be used repeatedly.
Indicates that the texture type is not known.
WrapMode enumerates the different fill modes for textures.
Indicates that the texture is applied to the surface “as is”. The part of the surface that is not covered by the texture is shown fully transparent. [cf. COLLADA]
Indicates that the texture is repeated until the surface is fully covered. [cf. COLLADA]
Indicates that the texture is repeated and mirrored. [cf. COLLADA]
Indicates that the texture is stretched to the edges of the surface. [cf. COLLADA]

Indicates that the texture is applied to the surface “as is”. The part of the surface that is not covered by the texture is filled with the RGBA color that is specified in the attribute borderColor. [cf. COLLADA]

The CityFurniture module supports representation of city furniture objects. City furniture objects are immovable objects like lanterns, traffic signs, advertising columns, benches, or bus stops that can be found in traffic areas, residential areas, on squares, or in built-up areas.
CityFurniture is an object or piece of equipment installed in the outdoor environment for various purposes. Examples include street signs, traffic signals, street lamps, benches, fountains.
Indicates the specific type of the CityFurniture.
Specifies the intended purposes of the CityFurniture.
Specifies the actual uses of the CityFurniture.
Augments the CityFurniture with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: ADEOfCityFurniture acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a CityFurniture.

sec.title: Basic Types
sec.p: none

sec.title: Unions
sec.p: none

tr.td: CityFurnitureClassValue is a code list used to further classify a CityFurniture.
CityFurnitureFunctionValue is a code list that enumerates the different purposes of a CityFurniture.
CityFurnitureUsageValue is a code list that enumerates the different uses of a CityFurniture.

sec.title: Enumerations
sec.p: none

tr.td: The CityObjectGroup module supports grouping of city objects. Arbitrary city objects may be aggregated in groups according to user-defined criteria. A group may be further classified by application-specific attributes.

A CityObjectGroup represents an application-specific aggregation of city objects according to some user-defined criteria. Examples for groups are the buildings in a specific region, the result of a query, or objects put together for visualization purposes. Each member of a group may be qualified by a role name, reflecting the role each city object plays in the context of the group.
Relates to a city object to which the CityObjectGroup belongs.
Relates to the city objects that are part of the CityObjectGroup.
Indicates the specific type of the CityObjectGroup.
Specifies the intended purposes of the CityObjectGroup.
Specifies the actual usages of the CityObjectGroup.
Augments the CityObjectGroup with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: Role qualifies the function of a city object within the CityObjectGroup.
Describes the role the city object plays within the CityObjectGroup.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: ADEOfCityObjectGroup acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a CityObjectGroup.

sec.title: Basic Types
sec.p: none

sec.title: Unions
sec.p: none

tr.td: CityObjectGroupClassValue is a code list used to further classify a CityObjectGroup.
CityObjectGroupFunctionValue is a code list that enumerates the different purposes of a CityObjectGroup.
CityObjectGroupUsageValue is a code list that enumerates the different uses of a CityObjectGroup.

sec.title: Enumerations
sec.p: none

tr.td: The Dynamizer module supports the injection of timeseries data for individual attributes of CityGML features. Timeseries data can either be retrieved from external Sensor APIs (e.g. OGC SensorThings API, OGC Sensor Observation Services, MQTT, proprietary platforms), external standardized timeseries files (e.g. OGC TimeseriesML or OGC Observations & Measurements), external tabulated files (e.g CSV) or can be represented inline as basic time-value pairs.

AbstractAtomicTimeseries represents the attributes and relationships that are common to all kinds of atomic timeseries (GenericTimeseries, TabulatedFileTimeseries, StandardFileTimeseries). An atomic timeseries represents time-varying data of a specific data type for a single contiguous time interval.
Specifies the phenomenon for which the atomic timeseries provides observation values.
Specifies the unit of measurement of the observation values.
Augments AbstractAtomicTimeseries with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: AbstractTimeseries is the abstract superclass representing any type of timeseries data.
Specifies the beginning of the timeseries.
Specifies the end of the timeseries.
Augments AbstractTimeseries with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: A CompositeTimeseries is a (possibly recursive) aggregation of atomic and composite timeseries. The components of a composite timeseries must have non-overlapping time intervals.
Relates to the atomic and composite timeseries that are part of the CompositeTimeseries. The referenced timeseries are sequentially ordered.
Augments the CompositeTimeseries with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: A Dynamizer is an object that injects timeseries data for an individual attribute of the city object in which it is included. The timeseries data overrides the static value of the referenced city object attribute in order to represent dynamic (time-dependent) variations of its value.
Relates to the timeseries data that is given either inline within a CityGML dataset or by a link to an external file containing timeseries data.
Relates to the sensor API that delivers timeseries data.
Specifies the attribute of a CityGML feature whose value is overridden or replaced by the (dynamic) values specified by the Dynamizer.
Specifies the beginning of the time span for which the Dynamizer provides dynamic values.
Specifies the end of the time span for which the Dynamizer provides dynamic values.
Augments the Dynamizer with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: A GenericTimeseries represents time-varying data in the form of embedded time-value-pairs of a specific data type for a single contiguous time interval.

dataTypeOfValue (OCL): inv: if valueType = TimeseriesTypeValue::integer then TimeValuePair→forAll(c | c.intValue→size()=1) else if valueType = TimeseriesTypeValue::double then TimeValuePair→forAll(c | c.doubleValue→size()=1) else if valueType = TimeseriesTypeValue::string then TimeValuePair→forAll(c | c.stringValue→size()=1) else if valueType = TimeseriesTypeValue::geometry then TimeValuePair→forAll(c | c.geometryValue→size()=1) else if valueType = TimeseriesTypeValue::uri then TimeValuePair→forAll(c | c.uriValue→size()=1) else if valueType = TimeseriesTypeValue::bool then TimeValuePair→forAll(c | c.boolValue→size()=1) else if valueType = TimeseriesTypeValue::implicitGeometry then TimeValuePair→forAll(c | c.implicitGeometryValue→size()=1) else TimeValuePair→forAll(c | c.appearanceValue→size()=1)
Relates to the time-value-pairs that are part of the GenericTimeseries.
Indicates the specific type of all time-value-pairs that are part of the GenericTimeseries.
Augments the GenericTimeseries with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: A StandardFileTimeseries represents time-varying data for a single contiguous time interval. The data is provided in an external file referenced in the StandardFileTimeseries. The data within the external file is encoded according to a dedicated format for the representation of timeseries data such as using the OGC TimeseriesML or OGC Observations & Measurements Standard. The data type of the data has to be specified within the external file.
Specifies the URI that points to the external timeseries file.
Specifies the format used to represent the timeseries data.
Specifies the MIME type of the external timeseries file.
Augments the StandardFileTimeseries with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: A TabulatedFileTimeseries represents time-varying data of a specific data type for a single contiguous time interval. The data is provided in an external file referenced in the TabulatedFileTimeseries. The file contains table structured data using an appropriate file format such as comma-separated values (CSV), Microsoft Excel (XLSX) or Google Spreadsheet. The timestamps and the values are given in specific columns of the table. Each row represents a single time-value-pair. A subset of rows can be selected using the idColumn and idValue attributes.

columnNumberOrColumnName (OCL): inv: (timeColumnNo→notEmpty() or timeColumnName→notEmpty()) and (valueColumnNo→notEmpty() or valueColumnName→notEmpty()) and (idValue→notEmpty() implies idColumnNo→notEmpty() or + idColumnName→notEmpty())
Specifies the URI that points to the external timeseries file.
Specifies the format used to represent the timeseries data.
Specifies the MIME type of the external timeseries file.
Indicates the specific type of the timeseries data.
Indicates the number of lines at the beginning of the tabulated file that represent headers.
Indicates which symbol is used to separate the individual values in the tabulated file.
Indicates which symbol is used to separate the integer part from the fractional part of a decimal number.
Specifies the number of the column that stores the identifier of the time-value-pair.
Specifies the name of the column that stores the identifier of the time-value-pair.
Specifies the value of the identifier for which the time-value-pairs are to be selected.
Specifies the number of the column that stores the timestamp of the time-value-pair.
Specifies the name of the column that stores the timestamp of the time-value-pair.
Specifies the number of the column that stores the value of the time-value-pair.
Specifies the name of the column that stores the value of the time-value-pair.
Augments the TabulatedFileTimeseries with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: ADEOfAbstractAtomicTimeseries acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractAtomicTimeseries.
ADEOfAbstractTimeseries acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to AbstractTimeseries.
ADEOfCompositeTimeseries acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a CompositeTimeseries.
ADEOfDynamizer acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a Dynamizer.
ADEOfGenericTimeseries acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a GenericTimeseries.
ADEOfStandardFileTimeseries acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a StandardFileTimeseries.
ADEOfTabulatedFileTimeseries acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a TabulatedFileTimeseries.

A SensorConnection provides all details that are required to retrieve a specific datastream from an external sensor web service. This data type comprises the service type (e.g. OGC SensorThings API, OGC Sensor Observation Services, MQTT, proprietary platforms), the URL of the sensor service, the identifier for the sensor or thing, and its observed property as well as information about the required authentication method.
Relates the sensor to the city object where it is located.
Indicates the type of Sensor API to which the SensorConnection refers.
Specifies the phenomenon for which the SensorConnection provides observations.
Specifies the unit of measurement of the observations.
Specifies the unique identifier of the sensor from which the SensorConnection retrieves observations.
Specifies the name of the sensor from which the SensorConnection retrieves observations.
Specifies the unique identifier of the observation that is retrieved by the SensorConnection.
Specifies the datastream that is retrieved by the SensorConnection.
Specifies the base URL of the Sensor API request.
Specifies the type of authentication required to be able to access the Sensor API.
Specifies the name of the MQTT Server. This attribute is relevant when the MQTT Protocol is used to connect to a Sensor API.
Names the specific datastream that is retrieved by the SensorConnection. This attribute is relevant when the MQTT Protocol is used to connect to a Sensor API.
Specifies the complete URL to the observation request.
Specifies the complete URL to the sensor description request.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: TimeseriesComponent represents an element of a CompositeTimeseries.
Relates a timeseries to the TimeseriesComponent.
Specifies how often the timeseries that is referenced by the TimeseriesComponent should be iterated.
Specifies how much extra time is added after all repetitions as an additional gap.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: A TimeValuePair represents a value that is valid for a given timepoint. For each TimeValuePair, only one of the value properties can be used mutually exclusive. Which value property has to be provided depends on the selected value type in the GenericTimeSeries feature, in which the TimeValuePair is included.

singleValue (OCL): inv: intValue→size() + doubleValue→size() + stringValue→size() + geometryValue→size() + uriValue→size() + boolValue→size() + implicitGeometryValue→size() + appearanceValue→size() = 1
Specifies the timepoint at which the value of the TimeValuePair is valid.
Specifies the “Integer” value of the TimeValuePair.
Specifies the “Double” value of the TimeValuePair.
Specifies the “String” value of the TimeValuePair.
Specifies the geometry value of the TimeValuePair.
Specifies the “URI” value of the TimeValuePair.
Specifies the “Boolean” value of the TimeValuePair.
Specifies the “ImplicitGeometry” value of the TimeValuePair.
Specifies the “Appearance” value of the TimeValuePair.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

sec.title: Basic Types
sec.p: none

sec.title: Unions
sec.p: none

tr.td: AuthenticationTypeValue is a code list used to specify the authentication method to be used to access the referenced sensor service. Each value provides enough information such that a software application could determine the required access credentials.

SensorConnectionTypeValue is a code list used to specify the type of the referenced sensor service. Each value provides enough information such that a software application would be able to identify the API type and version.
StandardFileTypeValue is a code list used to specify the type of the referenced external timeseries data file. Each value provides information about the standard and version.
TabulatedFileTypeValue is a code list used to specify the data format of the referenced external tabulated data file.
TimeseriesTypeValue enumerates the possible value types for GenericTimeseries and TimeValuePair.
Indicates that the values of the GenericTimeseries are of type “Integer”.
Indicates that the values of the GenericTimeseries are of type “Double”.
Indicates that the values of the GenericTimeseries are of type “String”.
Indicates that the values of the GenericTimeseries are geometries.
Indicates that the values of the GenericTimeseries are of type “URI”.
Indicates that the values of the GenericTimeseries are of type “Boolean”.
Indicates that the values of the GenericTimeseries are of type “ImplicitGeometry”.
Indicates that the values of the GenericTimeseries are of type “Appearance”.

The Generics module supports application-specific extensions to the CityGML data model. These extensions may be used to model and exchange additional attributes and features not covered by the predefined thematic classes of CityGML. Generic extensions shall only be used if appropriate thematic classes or attributes are not provided by any other CityGML module.
A GenericLogicalSpace is a space that is not represented by any explicitly modelled AbstractLogicalSpace subclass within CityGML.
Indicates the specific type of the GenericLogicalSpace.
Specifies the intended purposes of the GenericLogicalSpace.
Specifies the actual uses of the GenericLogicalSpace.
Augments the GenericLogicalSpace with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: A GenericOccupiedSpace is a space that is not represented by any explicitly modelled AbstractOccupiedSpace subclass within CityGML.
Indicates the specific type of the GenericOccupiedSpace.
Specifies the intended purposes of the GenericOccupiedSpace.
Specifies the actual uses of the GenericOccupiedSpace.
Augments the GenericOccupiedSpace with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: A GenericThematicSurface is a surface that is not represented by any explicitly modelled AbstractThematicSurface subclass within CityGML.
Indicates the specific type of the GenericThematicSurface.
Specifies the intended purposes of the GenericThematicSurface.
Specifies the actual uses of the GenericThematicSurface.
Augments the GenericThematicSurface with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: A GenericUnoccupiedSpace is a space that is not represented by any explicitly modelled AbstractUnoccupiedSpace subclass within CityGML.
Indicates the specific type of the GenericUnoccupiedSpace.
Specifies the intended purposes of the GenericUnoccupiedSpace.
Specifies the actual uses of the GenericUnoccupiedSpace.
Augments the GenericUnoccupiedSpace with properties defined in an ADE.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: ADEOfGenericLogicalSpace acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a GenericLogicalSpace.
ADEOfGenericOccupiedSpace acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a GenericOccupiedSpace.
ADEOfGenericThematicSurface acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a GenericThematicSurface.
ADEOfGenericUnoccupiedSpace acts as a hook to define properties within an ADE that are to be added to a GenericUnoccupiedSpace.
CodeAttribute is a data type used to define generic attributes of type “Code”.
Specifies the name of the CodeAttribute.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: DateAttribute is a data type used to define generic attributes of type “Date”.
Specifies the name of the DateAttribute.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: DoubleAttribute is a data type used to define generic attributes of type “Double”.
Specifies the name of the DoubleAttribute.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: A GenericAttributeSet is a named collection of generic attributes.
Relates to the generic attributes that are part of the GenericAttributeSet.
Specifies the name of the GenericAttributeSet.
Associates the GenericAttributeSet with an authority that maintains the collection of generic attributes.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: IntAttribute is a data type used to define generic attributes of type “Integer”.
Specifies the name of the IntAttribute.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: MeasureAttribute is a data type used to define generic attributes of type “Measure”.
Specifies the name of the MeasureAttribute.
Specifies the value of the MeasureAttribute. The value is of type “Measure”, which can additionally provide the units of measure. [cf. ISO 19103]

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: StringAttribute is a data type used to define generic attributes of type “String”.
Specifies the name of the StringAttribute.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».

tr.td: UriAttribute is a data type used to define generic attributes of type “URI”.
Specifies the name of the UriAttribute.

td.p: Note: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes and role names have the stereotype «Property».
